newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan wants 96/97 extra budget passed quickly -- MOF.
newsitem.headline: Japan wants 96/97 extra budget passed quickly -- MOF.

text.p: Finance Minister Hiroshi Mitsuzuka told a news conference on Friday that the government would seek to enact a supplementary budget for 1996/97 at the start the next parliamentary session beginning on Monday.
Mitsuzuka reiterated remarks he made earlier this week about the recent plunge in Tokyo stock prices.

"When we are hearing a warning from the stock market, it is important for us to take seamless steps to support the economy by seeking passage of the supplementary budget at the outset of the parliament session and enactment of the 1997/98 budget by the end of March 31," he said.
Mitsuzuka said the supplementary budget and the main budget for the next fiscal year were aimed at supporting the economy.
